member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.GeoJsonSerializer.Create(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings,NetTopologySuite.Geometries.GeometryFactory,System.Int32,NetTopologySuite.IO.RingOrientationOption)
member.summary: Factory method to create a (Geo)JsonSerializer using the provider serializer settings and geometry factory
member.param: The factory to use when creating a new geometry
A number of dimensions that are handled. Must be 2 or 3.
to ensure that rings are oriented according to the GeoJSON rule, to write out the coordinates in the order they are given.

member.name: M:NetTopologySuite.IO.GeoJsonSerializer.Create(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings,NetTopologySuite.Geometries.GeometryFactory,System.Int32,NetTopologySuite.IO.RingOrientationOption,Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings)
member.summary: Factory method to create a (Geo)JsonSerializer using the provider serializer settings and geometry factory
member.param: The factory to use when creating a new geometry
A number of dimensions that are handled. Must be 2 or 3.
to ensure that rings are oriented according to the GeoJSON rule, to write out whatever we have.

The to use when writing out "coordinates" arrays, or if we should just use . Intended to help fine-tune output, as "coordinates" arrays tend to be extremely long with many nested arrays that can look better stuffed onto one line by themselves, even if the rest of the JSON object is indented and split across multiple lines.

member.name: F:NetTopologySuite.IO.RingOrientationOption.NtsGeoJsonV2
member.summary: Polygon ring orientation is altered according to how it was done in NetTopologySuite.IO.GeoJSON v2 due to misinterpreting right-hand-rule:
